perturbation.original_text: Referral Fees will be paid within thirty (30) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral.
perturbation.changed_text: Referral Fees will be paid within sixty (60) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms for referral fees. Initially, the contract specifies payment within 30 days. By changing it to 60 days, it creates uncertainty about the actual deadline for payment. This inconsistency can lead to disputes between the parties regarding when the referral fees are due and payable, which creates potential legal ramifications.

perturbation.original_text: For a registered referral where the customer purchases directly from Company or another channel/contract vehicle other than Reseller, earned commissions are payable within thirty (30)days of when such amounts are collected by Company.
perturbation.changed_text: For a registered referral where the customer purchases directly from Company or another channel/contract vehicle other than Reseller, earned commissions are payable within fifteen (15) days of when such amounts are collected by Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly conflicts with the modified Section 6, creating further ambiguity. While Section 6 indicates a 60-day payment term, Exhibit B specifies a 15-day payment term for the same scenario. This inconsistency makes it unclear which payment deadline applies, potentially leading to legal disputes and making it difficult to enforce the contract.
perturbation.location: EXHIBIT B - Reseller Compensation - Payment Terms

perturbation.original_text: Contract is renewable for 1 year extension by amendment to this agreement. Either Party may terminate this agreement for non-cause with a sixty (60) written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Contract is renewable for 1 year extension by amendment to this agreement. Either Party may terminate this agreement for non-cause with a thirty (30) written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the notice period required for non-cause termination. The original text specified a 60-day notice, while the modified text states 30 days. This conflict creates uncertainty about the actual notice period required, which could lead to disputes if one party terminates the agreement based on the shorter notice period, while the other party believes a longer notice period is required. This is further exasperated by section 10 which has further details on termination.
